pros: The staff at college is very helping nature and supports you at each and every step
cons: Finding a parking space can be a difficut as the campuses are at the busy locations

pros: My colleagues are ace and we are very close and the students are great.
cons: At times I have been the subject to covert bullying and when I have challenged this I was gaslit and told I was overreacting, being dramatic and emotional which is not overly helpful. The last big manager that I had made a concerted effort to attempt to professionally destroy me, and had her minions (middle management) who continued this behaviour towards myself and other staff. Even long after they had gone... There is a disconnect between management and staff and a distinct imbalance to the volume of managers and non academic staff - considering we are an educational establishment and that should be our main focus. HR are also seemingly allowed to run riot and pretty much do what they want so this creates a culture where you feel that they exist primarily to safeguard managers and their poor behaviour.

review_title: Leeds Sixth form College staff review
pros: Bacon butties from the second floor cafe in B block on Park Lane
cons: I worked in the 6th form at LCC. Management are promoted in to posts with no interviews and no experience of managing people. Bullying is rife. Innovation is frowned upon. Teachers are treated like children. If you stand up for yourself, or your face doesn't fit, you are bullied out through disciplinary investigations. Management don't care about the mental well being of their staff and are totally incompetent as they do not learn from their mistakes. Staff turnover is high but they don't ask themselves why. Also there's no parking for the majority of staff and pay is well below teacher pay scales. For your own wellbeing DONT work there!

pros: Literally none that I can think of.
cons: Long hours No rewards, no benefits, it isn’t worth working towards the holidays for your time off as we’re told someone had to be in the office at all times even when no students were there.

review_title: I can't believe how bad it's gotten
pros: My team is actually really great. We work hard but treat each other with respect. My programme manager is great. Your mileage may vary depending on which team you're in.
cons: This college is managed so poorly that it's actually become comical. The persistence of the ELT to continue to treat education solely as a business venture, obsessed with constant growth, is absurd. Leeds City College has the lowest paid staff, by far, of any comparable College within 50 miles. The ELT pay absolutely no attention to feedback, and anyone questioning their ludicrous plans to become "world famous" is labelled as a "naysayer" (these are actual quotes from a conference a few years ago). There is constant gaslighting of staff. For example, they will send out a questionnaire every year and then only feed back responses to questions that were very carefully worded to force answers that appear to be positive. Anything that seems negative towards the direction the college is taking, anything that might reflect the true nature of the situation in this place is conveniently left out... not important, I suppose. The college recently sent out an email about a new 'benefit' they had put in place for staff struggling due to the cost of living crisis... a loan. They have brought in a company to offer loans to staff who are struggling and the college will take payments out of our wages each month to pay it back. You would think paying their staff better would be a more effective solution, but the college has been emailing us to explain that it is actually the unions that are preventing them from implementing their insultingly low 'payrise'. I get that everyone is struggling at the moment, but let's get this straight... a teacher at Leeds City College, at the top of the pay scale, is on ~£30k. Compare that to any other college in the area. It's appalling. Those in the higher positions of the college have had pretty comfortable pay rises this year. Apparently because they have taken on 'extra duties'... as though that's not something that has been forced on every member of staff, every year, for years, coupled with an effective year-by-year pay cut. All of this, it seems, is because the college prefers rapid expansion over quality service. They can't pay staff because they need more money for 'capital projects'. Good luck with those shiny new buildings when you can't find anyone to teach and support students in them. I'm absolutely done with this place.

review_title: Forget education - it's all about making money
pros: Colleagues working together are lovely. All staff on the lower levels support and help out each other.
cons: Too much time is spent on generating management information and the ultimate focus is on the college making money. Staff are berated when students leave, as it is considered to be the fault of the teachers. It's basically a dual culture organisation.

pros: Employee benefits, annual leave, equally diversity and inclusion
cons: Short staffed, doesn't recruit after people leave

pros: There are literally no pros
cons: Wanting you to start earlier finish later due to meetings Unorganised Full of naughty students

job_title: Customer Experience Assistant in Leeds, South East England, England
pros: Colleagues are nice and friendly
cons: Very very disorganised often demanded to work extra hours at very short notice and told to work at different locations on your way to work

pros: .it is a paaying job.
cons: .team treats staff like rubbish.

review_title: OUTSTANDING ART DEPARTMENT- WHAT A LOVELY TEAM :)
pros: I loved working at Leeds college teaching Btec Art. Such a wonderful, supportive and kind team. I wish I had never left to take on a new role at a different school (the grass isn't always greener). It was wonderful to work with people who really care about their job and at the same time enjoy it and have lots of fun! The students are brilliant and all really inspired due to having such a passionate team! Well done to all in the Art department- such a fabulous and supportive team!
cons: It was a little under funded when I worked there but that was before they moved to the lovely new building.

pros: Good support for staff from colleagues
cons: No cons to report that are notable.

pros: Caring staff and Reasonable working expectations.
cons:
Poor salary
No care for staff wellbeing
Bullying / Toxic environment 
Heavy staff turn over so lack of consistency for students.

job_title: Junior Web Developer in Leeds, England
pros: everything is great, people are awesome
cons: no cons, only pros, no lie

pros: Lots of course choices and good facilities
cons: In the centre of leeds

review_title: Leaving was probably the best decision of my life
pros: Making a difference to young peoples lives, being part of the wider community.
cons: Lack of human respect, unfair expectations, sneaky tricks and management cover ups.

pros: Good team to work in
cons: too many hours required for overtime

review_title: Students at the heart of everything
pros: Great values, colleagues are suppotive and genuinely care.
cons: Pace and workload is high at certain times of the year

review_title: Unorganised, poor company to work for
pros: Peer support- some of the other teachers were lovely and supportive.
cons:
Poor management teams, money is the main priority, no job stability, the application process is so rigid they often do not get the best candidate for the job, management do not look after their staff as everyone's job is constantly on the line so they will happily drop their staff in it so they keep their job. 
Just overall a poor company to work for with incapable staff managing departments and very unorganised.  I've recently had to listen to my deputy head of the department slam the single parent learners saying "They are worthless in educational and working environments and should have their legs taped shut"  (I kid you not from someone that should be supporting learners and their staff). Family-friendly policies are none existent but advertised on their application site. Every month half the staff didn't get paid correctly if at all and getting hold of someone in HR to fix this is near on impossible. Very poor organisation skills and the college will fail with this as nobody knows what they are doing. Learners having a different tutor each week if they are lucky enough to have classes without them being canceled due to a lack of staff (several members of staff off due to high workloads causing them to burn out).

pros: In my final year at Leeds City College, in one of the smaller campuses, I found the staff support and friendliness far exceeded that within the larger campuses such as Park Lane which was unfriendly and unsupportive.
cons: The lack of respect from management to teachers was deplorable, no support, added pressures and no thanks at the end of the day, week, term or year.   In my final year, even in a small campus, I did not have the luxury of a desk, computer, phone or even a place to hang my coat.  I was just a wanderer without any place to go.  Even though, as a lecturer, albeit a part time one, I did not have a place to work on admin work other than a corridor, if I was lucky.

job_title: IT Systems Technician in Leeds, England
pros: Having the opportunity to put my skills back into the education system and support learning through designing and implementing new technologies to replace and maintain legacy systems. Schools are particularly challenging as they are dictated by stagnating infrasturcture and the work and effort involved while balancing a tight budget often leads to innovative solutions and collaboration with all key members of other departments. More customer focused than most engineers get to be in other larger companies in a corporate culture.
cons: Legacy technology can be stifling and the tedious of day to day can become repetitive. Budgeting is often a blocker to any real successful endeavor during school terms however Summer holidays allow rapid development and increased productivity to look forward to.

review_title: Rapidly growing FE College who lets talent go too easily
pros:
One of the largest Colleges in the UK (3rd) so you are working with some of the best colleagues out there.
Google certified College leading the way with edtech.
Great autonomy given to teachers and managers.
Ownership of curriculum, financial and business planning.
Good systems and processes - particularly safeguarding and student support.
cons:
Too focused on data at higher levels - not enough enquiry into the situation on the ground.
Losing a lot of talented individuals because the demands are too high.
Very pressured environment.
Insufficient supervision and support for staff

review_title: this college is a centre of excellence
pros: this college has excellent staff who work as a team and know what they are doing and thrive in excellent training
cons: parts of the building fabric is dated and needs refurbishment I would update the entrance area and canteen and library areas

pros: CPD, Management and pay are the best parts of the role
cons: HE function and lack of progression within  the college are the reason for poor staff retention in BAU areas

cons: For me the biggest downside to Leeds City College is the travelling of more than one hour from home.
